commit_message:
User-agent header shouldn't start with a space

If the application name, sys.argv[0], is an empty string, like when
called from the Ansible os_network module, then keystoneauth (with
the new requests 2.11.0) will raise an exception saying:

Invalid return character or leading space in header: User-Agent

This comes from keystoneauth trying to prepend the empty module
name to the default user agent, which leads to it sending a
User-Agent header that starts with a blank space. This was fine
until the new requests 2.11.0 was released which errors if header
values start with a leading space.

With this change, if sys.argv[0] is an empty string we'll just use
the DEFAULT_USER_AGENT and not try to prepend a calling module.

Closes-Bug: #1611426

Change-Id: I56d3e352dce7628add0479b3333a880700844ebc
Signed-off-by: Matt Mulsow <mamulsow@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Keystone v2 and v3 manual and amulet/bundle testing

This provides both keystone v2 and v3 setup for testing barbican
manually.  It demonstrates how to set up a project/tenant in each v3 and
v2 and the how to store a secret.  Then only differences are in the
authentication with Keystone.  However, it does demonstrate both
working.

This change also contains the v2 and v3 keystone tests with barbican.
These are pesented as two gate-*-v2 and gate-*-v3 tests which activate
testing with keystone v2 and keystone v3.

Change-Id: Id0310da7a80ee8796eeda52b7af936ae51ed0dd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-barbican refs/changes/67/352967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python """Amulet tests on a basic barbican deployment on xenial-mitaka for keystone v3. """ from basic_deployment import BarbicanBasicDeployment if __name__ == '__main__': deployment = BarbicanBasicDeployment(series='xenial', keystone_version=3) deployment.run_tests()

IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES overwrites the existing correct

commit_message:
Remove duplicate parameters from local.conf example

IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES and IRONIC_NETWORK_INTERFACE are
duplicate in local.conf example for multitenant networking.

This patch removes these duplicate parameters.

Closes-Bug: 1611216
Change-Id: I860acf62e4cc62f2bfba44ab908cd8f8edc91f4a

commit_message:
Add some logging and a comment for shelve/unshelve operations

Since shelve_instance calls shelve_offload_instance it would
be useful to have some logging when we start those operations.
Do the same for unshelve since that is currently being called
during a Tempest run while shelve_offload_instance is still
running.

Also add a comment about why we have to set the instance.vm_state
before updating the resource tracker in shelve_offload_instance.

Change-Id: Ib9c08e4f9becf9500599d20e8f93ac75f2a77b5f
Related-Bug: #1611008

commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Skip test_router_interface_status for ML2

We currently never update status of purely logical ports
(in MidoNet term, interior ports) like router interfaces.
It ought to be fixed, but in case of ML2 it needs some mechanism
in ML2 driver api. [1]
For now, just skip the relevant test.

[1] Something like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336068/

Closes-Bug: #1608796
Related-Bug: #1507453
Change-Id: Ie0123333edfbb9681f166519cbd6d7d8dae5f2ae

commit_message:
Add tests for user-agent with odd sys.argv

There was no test that verified that when sys.argv is an empty
list or when sys.argv[0] is an empty string that the default
user-agent value is constructed as expected.

Change-Id: Iacf1557b6dbf48bf6bfb59d7cfbfec14e4fa8e56
Related-Bug: 1611426

subject: Run shelve/shelve_offload_instance in a semaphore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 18:42:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e285eb1a382e6d3ce1cc596eeb5cecb3b165a228', 'message': "Run shelve/shelve_offload_instance in a semaphore

When an instance is shelved, by default it is immediately
offloaded because CONF.shelved_offload_time defaults to 0.

When a shelved instance is offloaded, it's destroyed and it's
host/node values are nulled out.

Unshelving an instance is basically the same flow as building
an instance for the first time. The instance.host/node values
are set in the resource tracker when claiming resources.

Tempest has some tests which use a shared server resource and
perform actions on that shared server. These tests are triggering
a race when unshelve is called while the compute is offloading
the shelved instance. The race hits a window where unshelve is
running before shelve_offload_instance nulls out the instance
host/node values. The resource claim during unshelve sets the
host/node values (which were actually already set) and then
shelve_offload_instance nulls them out. The unshelve operation
sets the instance.vm_state to ACTIVE, however. So Tempest sees
an instance that's ACTIVE and thinks it can run the next action
test on it, for example 'suspend'. This fails because the
instance.host isn't set (from shelve_offload_instance) and the
test fails in the compute API.

To close the race window, we add a lock to shelve_instance and
shelve_offload_instance to match the lock that's in
unshelve_instance. This way when unshelve is called it will
wait until the shelve_offload_instance operation is complete
and the instance.host value is nulled out.

Closes-Bug: #1611008

Change-Id: Id36b3b9516d72d28519c18c38d98b646b47d288d
"}]
commit_message:
Run shelve/shelve_offload_instance in a semaphore

When an instance is shelved, by default it is immediately
offloaded because CONF.shelved_offload_time defaults to 0.

When a shelved instance is offloaded, it's destroyed and it's
host/node values are nulled out.

Unshelving an instance is basically the same flow as building
an instance for the first time. The instance.host/node values
are set in the resource tracker when claiming resources.

Tempest has some tests which use a shared server resource and
perform actions on that shared server. These tests are triggering
a race when unshelve is called while the compute is offloading
the shelved instance. The race hits a window where unshelve is
running before shelve_offload_instance nulls out the instance
host/node values. The resource claim during unshelve sets the
host/node values (which were actually already set) and then
shelve_offload_instance nulls them out. The unshelve operation
sets the instance.vm_state to ACTIVE, however. So Tempest sees
an instance that's ACTIVE and thinks it can run the next action
test on it, for example 'suspend'. This fails because the
instance.host isn't set (from shelve_offload_instance) and the
test fails in the compute API.

To close the race window, we add a lock to shelve_instance and
shelve_offload_instance to match the lock that's in
unshelve_instance. This way when unshelve is called it will
wait until the shelve_offload_instance operation is complete
and the instance.host value is nulled out.

Closes-Bug: #1611008

Change-Id: Id36b3b9516d72d28519c18c38d98b646b47d288d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/352554/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
BGP: exclude legacy fip in DVR fip host routes query

When query a bgpspeaker's routes, the DVR fip host routes query
will get the routes including the central fip routes. This will
let the central fip has more than one next_hop routes.

This patch adds a RouterExtraAttributes check for the distributed
routers during the DVR fip host routes query.

Closes-Bug: #1608406
(cherry picked from neutron-dynamic-routing commit
11965147fea9a52156ac2be265a5662973a4e5ad)

commit_message:
Fix tarball generation error due to missing tacker.conf

Sample tacker.conf is no longer included in the source
tree, instead the installer is expected to generate it.
Hence reference to etc/tacker/tacker.conf in setup.cfg
needs to be removed.

Closes-Bug: #1609739
Change-Id: I5abd6c95e93ed02740a061e1d9347774a3ce8c73

commit_message:
Fix constraints-git-prep

Reset ZUUL_NEWREV as well, otherwise it will be used for checkout which
is wrong since it references the project to checkout and not the
requirements repo which we need here.

Change-Id: If49f74913c338b1d8e19c37368867331361aac29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/54/352954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Delete HA network if last HA router is migrated

If an HA router is deleted and it's the last one a tenant has, the HA
network is deleted as it's no longer needed. The same should occur when
migrating the last HA router of a tenant from HA to Legacy.

Closes-Bug: #1610645
Change-Id: Ib27224c028bef98b78a5cea91e62ea98a2847008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/352068/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add force-delete into compute service

The exposed server delete is a soft action, which will cause unexpected
result if admin wants to delete the instance immediately. This patch
is to add interfaces for this purpose.

Change-Id: Ibfc4887e4bc367739b8945251e26d6d62117e3f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/23/352723/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add services operations into compute service

Nova has allowed to enable/disable/force_down services. This patch
is to add these interfaces into compute services. One direct use case
is in Senlin for fencing purpose.

Change-Id: I180be0e7af2859a355a6fc067c1fc66fe72ed01e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/61/351061/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.compute.v2 import service as _service def get_service(self, service): """Get a single service :param service: The value can be the ID of a serivce or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.service.Service` instance. :returns: A :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.serivce.Service` object. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceNotFound` when no resource can be found. """ return self._get(_service.Service, service) def force_down_service(self, service, host, binary): """force down a service :param service: Either the ID of a service or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Service` instance. :returns: None """ service = self._get_resource(_service.Service, service) service.force_down(self.session, host, binary) def disable_service(self, service, host, binary, disabled_reason=None): """force down a service :param service: Either the ID of a service or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Service` instance. :param str disabled_reason: The reason of force down a service. :returns: None """ service = self._get_resource(_service.Service, service) service.disable(self.session, host, binary, disabled_reason) def enable_service(self, service, host, binary): """enable a service :param service: Either the ID of a service or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.server.Service` instance. :returns: None """ service = self._get_resource(_service.Service, service) service.enable(self.session, host, binary) def services(self): """Return a generator of service :returns: A generator of service :rtype: class: `~openstack.compute.v2.service.Service` """ return self._list(_service.Service, paginated=False)

commit_message:
Fix nova server image and flavor

The Json response from nova server now contains a 'image' key and a
'flavor' key both of which are maps. When doing a server GET, we are
supposed to get those attributes directly. This patch adds the 'image'
and the 'flavor' properties.

Change-Id: I99bce08c80124d3b420785410b63e46c02ea6259
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/53/352853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'flavor': {'id': 'FLAVOR_ID', 'links': {}}, 'image': {'id': 'IMAGE_ID', 'links': {}}, self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['flavor'], sot.flavor) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['image'], sot.image)

commit_message:
Adding common PV and PVC scripts to ./service/common folder

Since PV and PVC templates are identical for all sercices, this PS makles them
a common template. Required size parameter will be passed from service_resources.yaml
After it is commited Mariadb and Glance will be repoted to use these scripts.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7fd58332ce0a9623b7a72f7310681ced93e68987

added_lines: {%- set resourceName = kolla_kubernetes.cli.args.service_name %} {%- if storage_provider in ["host", "ceph", "gce"] -%} apiVersion: v1 kind: PersistentVolume metadata: name: {{ resourceName }} spec: accessModes: - ReadWriteOnce capacity: storage: {{ kolla_kubernetes.template.vars.size_in_gb }}Gi {%- if storage_provider == "host" %} hostPath: path: /var/lib/kolla/volumes/{{ resourceName }} {%- elif storage_provider == "gce" %} gcePersistentDisk: pdName: {{ resourceName }} fsType: ext4 {%- elif storage_provider == "ceph" %} rbd: monitors: {%- for k in storage_ceph.monitors %} - "{{ k }}:6789" {%- endfor %} pool: {{ storage_ceph.pool }} image: {{ resourceName }} user: {{ storage_ceph.user }} keyring: {{ storage_ceph.keyring }} secretRef: name: {{ storage_ceph.secretName }} fsType: ext4 readOnly: false {%- endif %} {%- elif storage_provider == "aws" %} # NO-OP for AWS, which supports Experimental Persistent Volume Provisioning # https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.2/examples/experimental/persistent-volume-provisioning/README.md {%- else %} {{ raise('Unknown storage_provider: check kolla-kubernetes.yml:storage_provider') }} {%- endif %}

commit_message:
devstack: Don't bother to have our own l3 agent config file

Instead, simply add our config to Q_L3_CONF_FILE.

Closes-Bug: #1608401
Closes-Bug: #1609213
Depends-On: I630969b3556bcffba506cab02a09cc83f4430c88
Change-Id: Ibd186a81c5483ede3f1286e165efb55225198c51

subject: Update hacking check consumption
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 17:10:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/7b0cd3db2b05bac0a48fdd3d73f07df6f7b5bab0', 'message': 'Register hacking checks

Presently neutron-lib hacking checks are not registered
as flake8 extensions. As a result consumers are unable to use
select/ignore with flake8 (e.g. flake8 --ignore=N530 --select=N527).

This patch registers neutron-lib hacking checks using entry points
in setup.cfg and also ensures the check functions are wrapped
as needed for flake8 extensions via hacking.core.flake8ext()

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-27 20:37:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/5d3b250f07821e0acc742aa93928ea1d95fc4c61', 'message': 'Document hacking check consumption

Presently neutron-lib hacking checks are not registered out-of-the-box
as flake8 extensions. As a result consumers are unable to use
select/ignore with flake8 (e.g. flake8 --ignore=N530 --select=N527).

While some consumers would conveniently like neutron-lib
to register hacking checks via entry points, as a consumer agnostic
library we should let consumers define such behavior to remain as
generic as possible.

This patch updates our usage docs specifically with respect to
consuming hacking checks.

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-29 21:39:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/70769995718fd21a3f5b9f1543198b3dda54defb', 'message': 'Document hacking check consumption

Presently neutron-lib hacking checks are not registered out-of-the-box
as flake8 extensions. As a result consumers are unable to use
select/ignore with flake8 (e.g. flake8 --ignore=N530 --select=N527).

While some consumers would conveniently like neutron-lib
to register hacking checks via entry points, as a consumer agnostic
library we should let consumers define such behavior to remain as
generic as possible.

This patch updates our usage docs specifically with respect to
consuming hacking checks.

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-08 21:32:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/0d8fef83347bacb4169fe854ac92ce8d2228b824', 'message': 'Update hacking check consumption

This patch updates our hacking checks as follows:
- Hacking checks are now registered via entry points so
they can be used via flake8 CLI. By default they are disabled.
Hacking check doc string is also updated to support pep8
parsing of check code.
- The existing hacking.checks.factory() is moved to a more
meaningful name; marking as deprecated.
- A private neutron-lib specific hacking check factory is provided
and used in tox.ini.
- A flake8 plugin is provided that supports the ability to use our
hacking check factory functions to enable a pre-existing check
by default.
- Our usage of hacking checks is updated to reflect our consumption
model for adopters.
- Unit tests are provided.

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-09 14:25:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/8bd4d9bcb20d3ea4d205a385ed88239062365b50', 'message': 'Update hacking check consumption

commit_message:
Update hacking check consumption

This patch updates our hacking checks as follows:
- Hacking checks are now registered via entry points so
they can be used via flake8 CLI. By default they are disabled.
Hacking check doc string is also updated to support pep8
parsing of check code.
- The existing hacking.checks.factory() is moved to a more
meaningful name; marking as deprecated.
- A private neutron-lib specific hacking check factory is provided
and used in tox.ini.
- A flake8 plugin is provided that supports the ability to use our
hacking check factory functions to enable a pre-existing check
by default.
- Our usage of hacking checks is updated to reflect our consumption
model for adopters.
- Unit tests are provided.

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a

commit_message:
Fix str_split function when string is None

Currently str_split raises error, when function take string to split as
NoneType object (e.g. get_attr value during validation). Fix such
behaviour to allow resources with str_split in properties pass
validation.

Change-Id: Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196
Closes-bug: #1608482
(cherry-picked from Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196)

commit_message:
Ignore errors deserializing revocation events

Rather than fail if the data returned from the cache is invalid,
just return that there's no data present. Typically, when there's
a cache problem (e.g., if memcache is unreachable) the error is
ignored and doesn't cause operations to fail.

NOTE: Maybe I should move this up the stack and handle it in
keystone/common/cache/_context_cache.py ?

Change-Id: I70cfb6c4547275f8ff6d7d73459e77bb41ed79d8
Closes-Bug: 1609566

commit_message:
Update devstack configure_ironic_ssh_keypair

When authorized_file doesn't contain new-line character at the end,
configure_ironic_ssh_keypair() just append new key to the existed line,
as result both keys becomes corrupted. The patch adds a check for
last character in the authorized_key file, if new-line is missed
add it.

Change-Id: I64a7bba5f3c7dee76ae2faf659af1231280f2b8b
Closes-Bug: #1611207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/352714/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(vsaienko) check for new line character, add if doesn't exist. if [[ "$(tail -c1 $IRONIC_AUTHORIZED_KEYS_FILE | wc -l)" == "0" ]]; then echo "" >> $IRONIC_AUTHORIZED_KEYS_FILE fi

commit_message:
Refactor image v2 to use resource2/proxy2

This change includes the necessary refactoring to make the Image v2
service use the newer resource and proxy classes. Additionally, it
rearranged some of the structure of the Image resource in order to work
more logically on the surface of the proxy.

1. What was known as the Tag resource is now served by methods on the
Image resource, as tags are specific to an Image and not well served to
be thought of as their own thing. The behavior and tests have been moved
under Image, and at the proxy layer the calls were name "add_tag" and
"remove tag"
2. Image now supports the "deactivate" and "reactivate" actions.
3. The upload_image call was restructured slightly and is now helpfully
strict on the arguments it requires, as it takes two separate REST calls
in order to complete the operation.
4. download_image was added, and it verifies the checksum of the image
before returning the raw data. We previously converged on
download_<resource> as the naming convention of data being downloaded,
but we hadn't figured out what should be returned. A comment was added
to download_object in object_store as it currently tries to work with
writing to a file, which it should not do. That will be handled in that
service's refactor.

Change-Id: I22739d8a5b6c13552c9bdd980af0c2d62a66668d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/58/347458/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(briancurtin): call this download_object and make sure it's # just returning the raw data, like download_image does # TODO(briancurtin): download_object should really have the behavior # of get_object, and this writing to a file should not exist. # TODO(briancurtin): This method should probably offload the get # operation into another thread or something of that nature.

commit_message:
Add long option to network trunk list command

This patch adds a '--long' option to trunk list OSC CLI. Using
'--long' option will now allow user to see additional fields
while listing all trunks.

This patch is also a follow up patch for change
I6fe1dbd81813fae234801a61c0e3d89f9e7c791e to address multiple
TODOs like importing modules from osc-lib instead direct imports
and adding exception handling for NetworkTrunkSet command with
appropriate unit tests.

Change-Id: Iae1801b0b4f6bc2ca434290041ab5277285e400b

commit_message:
Add insecure/ca-cert option for magnumclient

This patch fixes the issue mentioned in bug#1611114
that there is no way to specify for insecure magnumclient
as a result api throws 500 and SSL cert verify errors.

Change-Id: I6283004e2a28658b22f122279832b9a49c0bed75
Closes-Bug: #1611114

commit_message:
create release-check high priority queue

Create a higher priority queue for checking release patches and move the
jobs for openstack/releases into it. The goal of doing this is to reduce
the wait time for release processing on busy days when there are a lot
of other patches in the normal check queue. The jobs in question are
pretty quick, but we still often end up waiting a long time for them to
start, which delays releases that may be needed to fix issues that are
going to cause other jobs to fail anyway.

Change-Id: I3df8171e6bb3b94d9cc0058519275644dccaa9b2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Introduce type:deployment tag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 21:31:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/53127ee107aec98667f7a4f7123dd2383d14780d', 'message': "Introduce type:deployment tag

There are four deployment projects in the governance repository at
present including Fuel, OSA, Kolla, TripleO.  Some of the tags
may need special logic to handle deployment projects.  For example
the assert type classification has hard-coded requirements for
type:service in upgrades which will require modification to
implement proper tagging of deployment tools which implement
upgrade processes.

Since deployment has become a type by de-facto development, it
makes sense to inform Operators that the project is a deployment
project via OpenStack's various automated tooling.  Further as
is, deployment projects are sometimes excluded from asserting
certain tags that they already meet or could easily meet becauase
they are limited to only type:service.

Change-Id: I4b342430f1d0db269d7b88d6b4226108fae4e370
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-22 17:28:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/8aa7f1bfcc7017ff1a461ac3234a628b8ff75272', 'message': "Introduce type:deployment tag

There are four deployment projects in the governance repository at
present including Chef, Fuel, OSA, Puppet, Kolla, TripleO.  Some of
the tags may need special logic to handle deployment projects.  For

commit_message:
Introduce type:deployment tag

There are at laest six deployment projects in the governance repository
at present including Chef, Fuel, OSA, Puppet, Kolla, TripleO.  Some of
the tags may need special logic to handle deployment projects.  For
example the assert type classification has hard-coded requirements for
type:service in assert:supports-upgrade which will require modification
to implement proper tagging of deployment tools which implement
upgrade processes.

Since deployment has become a type by de-facto development, it
makes sense to inform Operators that the project is a deployment
project via OpenStack's various automated tooling.  Further as
is, deployment projects are sometimes excluded from asserting
certain tags that they already meet or could easily meet because
they are limited to only type:service.

Change-Id: I4b342430f1d0db269d7b88d6b4226108fae4e370
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/28/295528/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. _`tag-type:deployment`: ================= type:deployment ================= This tag is part of the type-classification system for projects managed by the release team. ``type:deployment`` indicates that a project provides a service for deploying OpenStack platforms. Application to current projects =============================== .. tagged-projects:: type:deployment Rationale ========= The release team is building some tools for automating common release processes. Some of these tools will look at the type of the repository to make choices, including skipping or including the repository or applying different criteria or process steps. For example, deployment tools may have different criteria requirements for other tags such as upgrades. Requirements ============ * The repository contains software that deploys at minimum deliverables tagged with starter-kit:compute in the projects.yaml file. Tag application process ======================= Anyone may propose adding or removing this tag to a set of projects by proposing a change to the openstack/governance repository. The change is reviewed by the Release Team and Technical Committee and approved using standard resolution approval rules, including discussion at at least one Technical Committee public IRC meeting. Deprecation =========== There is no deprecation process for tags in the ``type`` namespace. If we need to change the type of a project, we can just do that.

commit_message:
Introduce a type:packaging tag

This tag represents projects which package OpenStack software into
distinct units for consumption by deployment tools.  The packaging
model is left to discretion of individual who tags the repository.

At this time, I believe this packaging model would apply to deb files,
dib elements, docker files, and rpm files.

The value of this change is to properly tag our repositories so
Operators can determine which repositories are responsible for
creating packaged versions of OpenStack compute-kit software (at
minimum).

Change-Id: I81a7d9d0d5a08987540763409bf2f04d7823ca92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/71/295971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. _`tag-type:packaging`: ================= type:packaging ================= This tag is part of the type-classification system for projects managed by the release team. ``type:packaging`` indicates that a project provides OpenStack packaging for usage by deployment systems. Application to current projects =============================== .. tagged-projects:: type:packaging Rationale ========= The release team is building some tools for automating common release processes. Some of these tools will look at the type of the repository to make choices, including skipping or including the repository or applying different criteria or process steps. Requirements ============ * The repository contains software that packages OpenStack software into distinct units usable by deployment tools. * The OpenStack services tagged with starter-kit:coompute in the projects.yaml file shall all be packaged. * The server dependencies of starter-kit:compute shall be packaged including but not limited to a database and message queue service which integrate with oslo. * All dependencies required by the OpenStack services that aren't widely available in distributions or don't meet the version requirements shall be packaged. Tag application process ======================= Anyone may propose adding or removing this tag to a set of projects by proposing a change to the openstack/governance repository. The change is reviewed by the Release Team and Technical Committee and approved using standard resolution approval rules, including discussion at at least one Technical Committee public IRC meeting. Deprecation =========== There is no deprecation process for tags in the ``type`` namespace. If we need to change the type of a project, we can just do that.

Change dependency to use flavors

This makes sure we install the correct and only the correct dependencies
when installing taskflow, based on the driver one wants to use.

commit_message:
Trim tc-approved-release tag to just base IaaS projects

This commit removes the tc-approved-release tag from non-base IaaS
projects. This tag is only used for marking which projects the TC
says can be included in defcore. When it was first created "the
integrated release" at the time was used to initially populate it.
However, just as with most things in the pre-big-tent world this
wasn't actually a good answer. The tag should only applied to services
that form the base unit of IaaS for interoperability so this trims the
tag to only include those projects. Higher level services which
consume these projects are removed from the list, as are projects
which are outside the scope of this tag.

Change-Id: I76ab6758aebd0f534b84b594952f858e95391138

commit_message:
Remove times.dbm file for each tox run

If you run the py27 tox tests then attempt to run the py34 tests,
the following error will occur:

    py34 runtests: commands[0] | ostestr
    --blacklist_file=blacklist-py3.txt
    db type could not be determined
    running=${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover
    ./trove/tests/unittests --list
    The test run didn't actually run any tests

This happens because the apparently the times.dbm file generated
by py27 is not compatible with py34. The converse is not true though -
if you run py34 first, py27 will work.

The work-around is to delete the file, which is what is now done
before running every tox test. Once the bug has been fixed, the
work-around can be removed.

This was originally noticed in python-troveclient, however it
also manifests in the Trove project.

coverage.xml was also added to the .gitignore file as it
was appearing in the git list of modified files.

Change-Id: I312b3879c764b7b803d35e0bb62f0f47291f6693
Closes-Bug: #1565928
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/27/343827/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm ostestr --blacklist_file=blacklist-py3.txt whitelist_externals = rm

commit_message:
Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro

sbuild is setup to use "jessie-newton", but the backports repository
is called "jessie-newton-backports". It'd be annoying to have special
cases for the install of sbuild. It is a lot easier to just add
--ignore=wrongdistribution when calling reprepro, which is what this
patch is doing.

Change-Id: I5619e8d2cd593e0a598127e5d8113ed293fee6aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/67/352867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: reprepro --ignore=wrongdistribution \ --confdir /etc/reprepro/{reprepro}"

commit_message:
fix diff-start handling in release scripts

Always provide a non-empty value for diff-start, but use "-" to signal
that the announce script should use the last tag as the starting
point.

Pass the value from list_deliverable_changes.py to release.sh correctly.

Change-Id: If56bf1471659f8a27edbed840a880ac998e6759a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

swap the number of elected members per season in order to be compliant
with the charter and the required number of members.

From this moment on, 7 members will be elected on the Northern Fall
election and 6 on the following one.

Change-Id: Idd0752d4f76cbad257dbc588bfd053a4fefd7fca
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-04 13:55:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/8a528b77441590f4593bcd27adbbdb86aa75cf50', 'message': 'Swap number of elected members per season

As a result of one of the current TC members stepping down, we need to
swap the number of elected members per season in order to be compliant
with the charter and the required number of members.

From this moment on, 7 members will be elected on the Northern Fall
election and 6 on the following one.

Change-Id: Idd0752d4f76cbad257dbc588bfd053a4fefd7fca
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-05 08:23:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/109c3152d8eea5dbdabb5378672426a34e13a014', 'message': "Don't be specific on when 7 members are elected

Instead of explicitly specifying when 7 members will be elected, this
patch adapts the wording so that it is clear that there's one round for
7 members and another one for 6 without specifying when in the year that
happens.

Change-Id: Idd0752d4f76cbad257dbc588bfd053a4fefd7fca
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 19:52:01.000000000', 'files': ['reference/charter.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/7d4f440c59296c6c0429ddf152c32abe060d5e5b', 'message': "Don't be specific the number of seats per election

Instead of explicitly specifying when 7 members will be elected, this
patch adapts the wording so that it is clear that all the opened seats
would need to be filled on every election.

Change-Id: Idd0752d4f76cbad257dbc588bfd053a4fefd7fca
"}]
commit_message:
Don't be specific the number of seats per election

Instead of explicitly specifying when 7 members will be elected, this
patch adapts the wording so that it is clear that all the opened seats
would need to be filled on every election.

Change-Id: Idd0752d4f76cbad257dbc588bfd053a4fefd7fca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/04/351104/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 7 seats are renewed every (Northern hemisphere) Fall, and 6 seats are renewed
deleted_lines: 6 seats are renewed every (Northern hemisphere) Fall, and 7 seats are renewed

Networking-l2gw: enable python 3 voting

Commit 327f5d3af50a95d6f57b4fe24c0a2ad9f4daa3b3 ensured that the
python 3 tests passed.

We can now have the voting enabled.

Set VERSION in VNX cinder driver

This patch is to move VERSION to VNX driver class,
so Cinder can get correct driver version.

subject: Correct InventoryList model references
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 21:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5bba451f35b256b04ce36f647a6d5fe6c04fa192', 'message': "Correct InventoryList model references

InventoryList._get_all_by_resource_provider was indicating models to
use in a query by db_api.models.[model] which meant that the models
that were being used were those designed for the main/cell database,
not the api database as intended. Since there are duplicates of many
of the resource provider related models between sqlalchemy/models.py
and sqlalchemy/api_models.py this wasn't making any difference in
testing: the context controls the database being used not the
models.

However, since at some point we might clear up the orphaned models
it is best to correct this now to avoid confusion later.

Change-Id: I0ff01ec1b7de0bfbd194846a1381ddc2e665b735
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}]
commit_message:
Correct InventoryList model references

InventoryList._get_all_by_resource_provider was indicating models to
use in a query by db_api.models.[model] which meant that the models
that were being used were those designed for the main/cell database,
not the api database as intended. Since there are duplicates of many
of the resource provider related models between sqlalchemy/models.py
and sqlalchemy/api_models.py this wasn't making any difference in
testing: the context controls the database being used not the
models.

However, since at some point we might clear up the orphaned models
it is best to correct this now to avoid confusion later.

Change-Id: I0ff01ec1b7de0bfbd194846a1381ddc2e665b735
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/352047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return context.session.query(models.Inventory).\ join(models.Inventory.resource_provider).\ filter(models.ResourceProvider.uuid == rp_uuid).all()

commit_message:
Cleanup: validate option at config read level

It's not necessary to make validation for negative retries
in code if we have IntOpt min option.

Change-Id: I3d42472604d86ba2e5e9b674e8ec2017849aa15a

commit_message:
Only run one docs job on devstack

During the migration from trusty -> xenial the docs jobs a branch
filter was missed on the docs job for devstack. This resulted in
2 docs jobs running on every commit, one on trusty the other on
master. This commit fixes the oversight and just runs the xenial job
on master, but leaves the trusty job for stable branches.

Change-Id: Iae1e4972c870e0390225ceda901d676e62e7aaba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/71/351971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
change django_openstack_auth to not use canonical name

The release job that tried to update this constraint failed because the
name in the setup.cfg package metadata did not match the name here in
the constraints list. We could change the name in the metadata, but that
would break a bunch of links to existing build artifacts. Since a lot of
other packages in this file do not use the canonical name, let's change
this entry to use the name from setup.cfg instead of the canonical form.

Change-Id: I2a584195063fed11b4ee51b783045331815a8576
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use --validation-errros-nonfatal in osinfra jobs

Now that I9f77cd66547082b390c0c15034a2759e431045c5 has merged, we need
to allow make the validation errors nonfatal in the multinode job so
that validations such as the hypervisor stats check does not fail these
jobs.

Change-Id: I31fd8d2ce6a29963907556e09a5472b44c4a3a0e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/75/352975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement nova-lxd driver

This patch set is designed to allow deployers to select
the virt_type = 'lxc', which will deploy the nova-lxd
driver instead of the usual kvm driver.

Change-Id: I8b298080faaef9da1ab0040de437086a1a393296
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/84/346984/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lxc: nova_compute_driver: nova.virt.lxd.LXDDriver nova_scheduler_host_manager: host_manager nova_reserved_host_memory_mb: 2048 nova_compute_manager: nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager nova_firewall_driver: nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver nova_scheduler_use_baremetal_filters: False nova_scheduler_tracks_instance_changes: True# Current supported choice: qemu or kvm or lxc or ironic or powervmnova_compute_lxd_pip_packages: - pyOpenSSL - pylxd - nova-lxd lxd_bind_address: 0.0.0.0 lxd_bind_port: 8443 lxd_storage_backend: dir # This needs to be set in the user_secrets.yml file. #lxd_trust_password:
deleted_lines: # Current supported choice: qemu or kvm or ironic or powervmnova_compute_powervm_pip_packages: - nova-powervm

commit_message:
WIP: restart ntpd to sync time

ntp-wait doesn't exist on fedora platforms.

Change-Id: Id71ecbe9e15fe36d73f53135b3ca04fa01f87425
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/21/352621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_fedora; then local ntp_service='ntpd' elif uses_debs; then local ntp_service='ntp' else echo "Unsupported platform, can't determine ntp service" exit 1 fi sudo service $ntp_service restart

subject: Cells: Handle delete with BuildRequest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 15:24:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c08a75f69cc283b765428e7b0b4e9bed0a9bab56', 'message': 'Cells: Handle delete with BuildRequest

When an instance delete is issued the instance could be in a few
different states which require different handling.

If the instance is in a cell and booted or booting then the delete can
proceed normally.

If there is a BuildRequest object for the instance then it is still
being built and has not reached a cell yet. In this situation there may
or may not also be an instance record depending on how much future work
has merged. The BuildRequest should be destroyed, any InstanceMapping
that exists should be cleaned up, and if there is an Instance it should
be deleted normally.

Change-Id: I27d89143e8804aebdd414791f03b622abdaafe90
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-17 19:27:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/51ebccf1688a1cfc86ce59753d1ed319dffac215', 'message': 'Cells: Handle delete with BuildRequest

When an instance delete is issued the instance could be in a few
different states which require different handling.

If the instance is in a cell and booted or booting then the delete can
proceed normally.

If there is a BuildRequest object for the instance then it is still
being built and has not reached a cell yet. In this situation there may
or may not also be an instance record depending on how much future work
has merged. The BuildRequest should be destroyed, any InstanceMapping
that exists should be cleaned up, and if there is an Instance it should
be deleted normally.

The added functional test does not check for a change in behavior. It
ensures that the behavior of delete does not change as the delete
process is updated. Note that the only delete path that bails early is
not yet reachable. The test keeps things honest as that changes.

Change-Id: I27d89143e8804aebdd414791f03b622abdaafe90
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

commit_message:
Cells: Handle delete with BuildRequest

When an instance delete is issued the instance could be in a few
different states which require different handling.

If the instance is in a cell and booted or booting then the delete can
proceed normally.

If there is a BuildRequest object for the instance then it is still
being built and has not reached a cell yet. In this situation there may
or may not also be an instance record depending on how much future work
has merged. The BuildRequest should be destroyed, any InstanceMapping
that exists should be cleaned up, and if there is an Instance it should
be deleted normally.

The added functional test does not check for a change in behavior. It
ensures that the behavior of delete does not change as the delete
process is updated. Note that the only delete path that bails early is
not yet reachable. The test keeps things honest as that changes.

Change-Id: I27d89143e8804aebdd414791f03b622abdaafe90
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/325985/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If there is a host set we know that there is no BuildRequest. This # should be the common case. # Not having a host does not guarantee the BuildRequest still exists. if not instance.host: # If there is a BuildRequest then the instance may not have been # written to a cell db yet. Delete the BuildRequest here, which # will indicate that the Instance build should not proceed. # TODO(alaski): handle quotas. try: build_req = objects.BuildRequest.get_by_instance_uuid( context, instance.uuid) build_req.destroy() except exception.BuildRequestNotFound: # This means the delete came in before the resource claim on # the host, but in the time it took to get to this point the # instance was passed to a cell and the BuildRequest was # deleted. Delete the instance normally. pass else: try: # This should get cleaned up in the conductor when it # notices that the BuildRequest was deleted. But to be # safe let's attempt it here as well. inst_map = objects.InstanceMapping.get_by_instance_uuid( context, instance.uuid) inst_map.destroy() except exception.InstanceMappingNotFound: pass # TODO(alaski): Uncomment this when instance creation happens # in conductor and deleting BuildRequest will halt it. # return try: instance = self.get(context, instance.uuid, want_objects=True) except exception.InstanceNotFound: # If no instance was found then it is truly deleted. If an # instance is found then instance creation has not moved to # the conductor yet. # Quota handling needs to happen before bailing early here. project_id, user_id = quotas_obj.ids_from_instance( context, instance) quotas = self._create_reservations(context, instance, instance.task_state, project_id, user_id) quotas.commit() return

commit_message:
Fix senlin integration test job

This patch fixes senlin integration test job by
setting DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 in job template.
Without it, neutron network environment won't be
set up correctly.

Change-Id: Idc607edb827f77a2e3a336000ad09f55655d4cbb

commit_message:
Fix Ironic functional job by properly setting PROJECTS

When we construct the environment Ironic functional gate job,
we got the following error:

The /opt/stack/new/ironic-python-agent project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

This patch adds openstack/ironic-python-agent to $PROJECTS
to fix this problem.

Change-Id: I57b886d62c2b6917d2cb0e300d1319d47477e578
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/72/352772/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export PROJECTS="openstack/ironic openstack/python-ironicclient openstack/ironic-python-agent $PROJECTS"

commit_message:
Fix warning when running tox -e api-ref

Running `tox -e api-ref` prints warning:

  WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
    cmd: /bin/rm
    env: /opt/stack/keystone/.tox/api-ref
  Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Change-Id: I4c1718dac22c374f048d9e04f42051e10021bb31

commit_message:
Remove manual setting of privsep helper

The privsep helper should have a sane default for all libraries,
pushing this into devstack means we cheat past a part of the upgrade
that we really shouldn't be.

Change-Id: I52259e2023e277e8fd62be5df4fd7f799e9b36d7

commit_message:
[POC] Remove most I/O inventory tests

Previous work on the dynamic inventory wrote to and read from the
filesystem in order to change configurations between tests. This was
problematic for a couple reasons:

    1) It leads to increased runtime for the unit tests, which was
    largely unnecessary. This change reduced the test runtime by about
    50%

    2) Failed tests and test suite interruptions (like ctrl-c) sometimes
    left behind files, which dirtied the git working tree. By writing
    out configuration to the file system, the git working tree was
    constantly being altered then reset. This change means that the
    inventory tests only ever read.

Mocks are used throughout the tests now in order to fake the filesystem
access. Currently, there is a large number of mocks because of the
coupling within the target codebase.

Change-Id: I10cf2c2ed36f159499e71525f73139da5e14b8be

subject: instance.name should be blank if instance.id is not set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 21:25:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/39771f768ff23b9a89070dd9eee95476b77bcb71', 'message': 'Add ability to override instance.name

By default the ability to generate instance.name depends on the
instance.id field. However the value for this field comes from the
autoincrement id column in the instance table. This means that if the
instance has not been written to a database, as will be the case before
scheduling in cellsv2, there is no way to properly determine what the
instance name will be.

This adds an ability to temporarily set a name to be used rather than
failing on an attempt to lazy-load the id field for the above cellsv2
case.

Change-Id: I4a743c61a619af6f91a102a219fc0ec49df19d9d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-08 21:46:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/26895643ddc7ebcba2e058e452a2aeda9648829b', 'message': "instance.name should be blank if instance.id is not set

By default the ability to generate instance.name depends on the
instance.id field. However the value for this field comes from the
autoincrement id column in the instance table. This means that if the
instance has not been written to a database, as will be the case before
scheduling in cellsv2, there is no way to properly determine what the
instance name will be.

In that situation the instance name will now be returned as ''. If the
instance_name_template does not depend on instance.id we could try to
return that, however determining if that's the case is non-trivial and
it would be better to be consistent with instance naming in all
pre-scheduling cases.

Change-Id: I4a743c61a619af6f91a102a219fc0ec49df19d9d

commit_message:
instance.name should be blank if instance.id is not set

By default the ability to generate instance.name depends on the
instance.id field. However the value for this field comes from the
autoincrement id column in the instance table. This means that if the
instance has not been written to a database, as will be the case before
scheduling in cellsv2, there is no way to properly determine what the
instance name will be.

In that situation the instance name will now be returned as '' if the
vm_state and task_state match the pre-scheduled instance case. If the
instance does not have the right vm_state/task_state set an error will
be logged and the instance uuid will be returned as the name. Using uuid
matches what happens for template failures.

Change-Id: I4a743c61a619af6f91a102a219fc0ec49df19d9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/327342/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid def test_name_override(self): self.flags(instance_name_template='foo-%(uuid)s') inst_uuid = str(uuid.uuid4()) inst = objects.Instance(context=self.context, id=1, uuid=inst_uuid) self.assertEqual('foo-%s' % inst_uuid, inst.name) inst._name = 'bar' self.assertEqual('bar', inst.name)

commit_message:
Add configure-devstack task for devstack gate

This patch adds 'configure-devstack' task to enable CORS headers in
keystone before functional-test are run.
No 'ini' library was used as I didn't find any supporting section
syntax "[[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]"

Change-Id: I7f335bbba3a768387a7d77916df019ba46e5519f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/38/351938/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "configure-devstack": "babel ./configure-devstack.js -d dist && node ./dist/configure-devstack.js",

commit_message:
SwiftBackupDriver: Dont add project_id to authurl

If using the config parameter backup_swift_auth_url for the
Swift backup driver in single_user mode, the project_id is
added to the auth_url. As the auth_url is expected to be a
keystone endpoint, this is not needed. This patch will fix
this.

Change-Id: I865fb2f1dff188c2886ee0ea35a8f0f3c48724b8
Closes-Bug: #1518199

commit_message:
Update ppc64el state setting behavior

Prevent attempts to set smt state in cases where the smt
state value is already set to the expected value.

Change-Id: I83682033cb46998c5e1ad8fe5986deecf6e4e89d
Closes-Bug: 1610536
(cherry picked from commit 8368e32df2adf2fafeaa2bb85a0cac4f595b7f65)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-compute refs/changes/55/352655/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status_set, current_smt_state = check_output(['ppc64_cpu', '--smt']) # Possible smt state values are integer or 'off' # Ex. common ppc64_cpu query command output values: # SMT=8 # -or- # SMT is off if 'SMT={}'.format(smt_state) in current_smt_state: log('Not changing ppc64_cpu smt state ({})'.format(smt_state)) elif smt_state == 'off' and 'SMT is off' in current_smt_state: log('Not changing ppc64_cpu smt state (already off)') else: log('Setting ppc64_cpu smt state: {}'.format(smt_state)) cmd = ['ppc64_cpu', '--smt={}'.format(smt_state)] try: check_output(cmd) except CalledProcessError as e: # Known to fail in a container (host must pre-configure smt) msg = 'Failed to set ppc64_cpu smt state: {}'.format(smt_state) log(msg, level=WARNING) status_set('blocked', msg) raise e
deleted_lines: log('Setting ppc64_cpu smt state: %s' % smt_state) cmd = ['ppc64_cpu', '--smt=%s' % smt_state] check_output(cmd)

commit_message:
Splitting current/deprecated integ. test

Horizon now is interested in having two integration tests: 1) current
2) deprecated panels.

This patch changes the integration job into a job-template and configures
Horizon to use both the current/deprecated jobs.  The job-template
passes the 'type' parameter into the pre-test hook so it can differentiate
and configure the test environment appropriately.

Change-Id: I1f2028c18d6d9933a986a9bc47750e1b5fdca708
Partially-Implements: blueprint test-deprecated-features

subject: Raise ValueError if empty value coming into encrypt_header_val
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 05:16:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9ec8b5be49c9b00a8931ed27185b76dacbc6b26f', 'message': "Add unit test for encrypt_header_val

One question is still remaining:

- When the value is empty, do we *really* need to return ('', None)?

encrypt_header_val is used to translate a raw header value into a
encrypted value. Semantically, a header with an empty value won't be stored
and all callers seem to remove such a header before calling
encrypted_header_val. (e.g. [1])

So if no reason for returning ('', None),  I'd like to change it to
raise ValueError not to cause another error for users of the return
value. (e.g. dump_crypto_meta)

1: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/crypto/encrypter.py#L211-L212

Change-Id: Ic1237f4afb8c0e466be5ce59fe31b667c39242b0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-04 07:14:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c8ce0b9ec7812f3b141c6f6f8c663a0ab6c412e6', 'message': "Add unit test for encrypt_header_val

One question is still remaining:

- When the value is empty, do we *really* need to return ('', None)?

encrypt_header_val is used to translate a raw header value into a
encrypted value. Semantically, a header with an empty value won't be stored
and all callers seem to remove such a header before calling
encrypted_header_val. (e.g. [1])

So if no reason for returning ('', None),  I'd like to change it to
raise ValueError not to cause another error for users of the return
value. (e.g. dump_crypto_meta)

1: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/crypto/encrypter.py#L211-L212

commit_message:
Raise ValueError if empty value coming into encrypt_header_val

encrypt_header_val is used to translate a raw header value into an
encrypted value. Semantically, a header with an empty value won't be stored
and all callers seem to remove such a header before calling
encrypted_header_val.

So if no reason for returning ('', None), I think it's better to change it to
raise ValueError not to cause another error for users of the return value.
(e.g. dump_crypto_meta)

Plus this patch addes a few unit tests for those cases above.

Change-Id: Ic1237f4afb8c0e466be5ce59fe31b667c39242b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/00/337000/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.middleware.crypto.keymaster import KeyMaster def test_encrypt_header_val(self): def get_encrypted_val(value): crypto = Crypto({}) root_secret = base64.b64encode('a' * 32) # set lambda instead of real app because # this test only needs create_key method) master = KeyMaster( lambda: None, {'encryption_root_secret': root_secret}) encrypted = encrypter.encrypt_header_val( crypto, value, master.create_key('/a/c/o')) # sanity: return value is 2 item tuple self.assertEqual(2, len(encrypted)) return encrypted expected_crypt_info = { 'cipher': 'AES_CTR_256', 'iv': 'This is an IV123'} # normal string can be crypted crypted_val, crypt_info = get_encrypted_val('aaa') self.assertEqual('jal8', crypted_val) self.assertEqual(expected_crypt_info, crypt_info) # empty string can return ('', None) crypted_val, crypt_info = get_encrypted_val('') self.assertEqual('', crypted_val) self.assertEqual(None, crypt_info)

commit_message:
Fix the mocking mess

Our tests' mocking is a little messy, we have tests that start a mocking
but don't stop it, others try to stop it but use a mock object instead
of a patcher object, so they don't stop it, and we keep using stopall to
stop the patchings instead of individual stops, and we've seen in Cinder
that this can be problematic.

This patch fixes these issue, most of them just by using base TestCase
mock_object method, and some calling the right stop method (ie:
VolumeEncryptorTestCase).

Change-Id: I545abfa8749e778e923c37e0b908efc578f70619

commit_message:
Storwize:create_volume_from_snapshot with different size

create_volume_from_snapshot, currently the Storwize driver
can't handle a volume size larger than the original snapshot.
This patch fixes this issue by extending the volume after
creating volume from the snapshot.

Change-Id: I895a2d152b464e3cc09c1c5fb8ec81539a263443
Closes-Bug: 1560658
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/55/349855/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if snapshot['volume_size'] > volume['size']: msg = (_("create_volume_from_snapshot: snapshot %(snapshot_name)s " "size is %(snapshot_size)dGB and doesn't fit in target " "volume %(volume_name)s of size %(volume_size)dGB.") % {'snapshot_name': snapshot['name'], 'snapshot_size': snapshot['volume_size'], 'volume_name': volume['name'], 'volume_size': volume['size']}) # The volume size is equal to the snapshot size in most # of the cases. But in some scenario, the volume size # may be bigger than the source volume size. # SVC does not support flashcopy between two volumes # with two different size. So use the snapshot size to # create volume first and then extend the volume to- # the target size. if volume['size'] > snapshot['volume_size']: # extend the new created target volume to expected size. self._extend_volume_op(volume, volume['size'], snapshot['volume_size'])
deleted_lines: if volume['size'] != snapshot['volume_size']: msg = (_('create_volume_from_snapshot: Source and destination ' 'size differ.'))

commit_message:
Add has_callbacks method to callbacks registry

This can be helpful in situations where someone wants to determine
whether or not other callbacks are listening to the same resource
event.

Change-Id: I8071ad025b855caa303c9ef1bf59f2b40c31f6fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/351872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def has_callbacks(resource, event): _get_callback_manager().subscribe(resource, event)

commit_message:
Add exception message translations

There were a few cases where strings sent to exceptions were not
being translated. According to the i18n guidelines, any strings
used for exceptions should use the _() marker.

This addresses the obvious cases where a string was being passed
in the exception constructor. There may be other cases where strings
are being assigned to a variable first before being passed in that
still need to be fixed.

Change-Id: I18e0a9bb9bc8ca06d6774ef992e500594df3d4b1

commit_message:
Revert "We don't need to set a default for the CephX keys and cluster FSID"

This reverts commit 9b1ceee031644c798c5c01d9689f15b4daf44aa7. In mitaka
we don't have roles so upgrade of those deployments not using Ceph will
fail validation unless we have a default set for these parameters.

Closes-Bug: 1610258
Change-Id: I58832df1deb17fbb7df4b2180aa61290852a8aaf

commit_message:
mitaka: release nova 13.1.1

This is just a bug fix update so the patch version
is incremented. The dependency updates are just
blacklists of bad dependencies, no new minimums
raised to force a minor version bump.

commit_message:
Cinder-backup requires iscsid running on the same host

Cinder-backup containers require iscsid to mount iscsi volumes
to backup if the volumes are on different storage host.

Change-Id: Ifc0a30584a4f086b71278616d34bf87863d3e6e5
Closes-Bug: 1611330

commit_message:
allow RHEL virthosts to use an updated ipxe-roms-qemu

RHEL by default also has an old ipxe-rom-qemu rpm.

The distro check has been rewritten in Change-Id: 348062

Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1267030
Related to oooq commit: 1d1c0d47661a4ddf371fdb72e635f478fb0c3669

Change-Id: I7c163a288f70f27a2c744587936f8f4d95e86764

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-24 16:55:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/01716413047674fb95054a6a8c4e3d96aa1b54fc', 'message': 'Make ironic ephemeral bdm match default value

Commit f8128f87f5a2fa93c857295fb7e4163986eda25 caused Nova to start
explicitly creating a mapping for ephemeral block devices, which
caused the metadata for Ironic ephemeral partitions to be incorrect.
This is because Ironic does not use the Nova bdm to assign devices,
which is a problem in and of itself.  See related bug below.

This change at least fixes the regression so that in the basic case
of a standard SATA ephemeral partition the device path returned by
the metadata server will match what was assigned in Ironic.  It
does not address environments where the ephemeral partition is on
another path such as /dev/vda1, but those do not appear to have
ever worked.

commit_message:
Make ironic ephemeral bdm match default value

Commit 7f8128f87f5a2fa93c857295fb7e4163986eda25 caused Nova to start
explicitly creating a mapping for ephemeral block devices, which
caused the metadata for Ironic ephemeral partitions to be incorrect.
This is because Ironic does not use the Nova bdm to assign devices,
which is a problem in and of itself.  See related bug below.

This change at least fixes the regression so that in the basic case
of a standard SATA ephemeral partition the device path returned by
the metadata server will match what was assigned in Ironic.  It
does not address environments where the ephemeral partition is on
another path such as /dev/vda1, but those do not appear to have
ever worked.

Change-Id: Ida25db52799a83d3d353fd61d178945201e9b8dc
Closes-Bug: 1464239
Related-Bug: 1478065
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/205271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bdms = objects.block_device.BlockDeviceMappingList.get_by_instance_uuid(context, instance.uuid) ephemeral_devices = [d['device_name'] for d in block_device_info['ephemerals']] print ephemeral_devices for bdm in bdms: if bdm.get('device_name') in ephemeral_devices: bdm.device_name = '/dev/sda1' bdm.save() break

commit_message:
Only db-sync sahara is included in the bootstrapnode

Currently, sahara's db-sync is run on every node. We should instead
run it if we're on the bootstrap node as race conditions may occur
and these will cause issues.

Change-Id: I5db281caae17402ff198cb4cd46304338d98c52e

commit_message:
Make notification objects use flavor capacity attributes

This makes the notification objects to  use instance.flavor.$resource
instead of instance.$resource.

The FlavorPayload schema has been changed but the version is not bumped
as this change does not affect the notification structure or content.

Change-Id: Ie1de19d0eb67e12e96e62b339c67f8ab8eb8999d

commit_message:
Change Quickstart to follow code conventions

  * Remove the -y for every occurance of package install
  * Replace `source` with `.`

according to
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I977c5dd58207be67a5bfc96d5ae1f9958b46089a

commit_message:
Fix repeated OPTIONS in swift-dispersion-report manpage

Remove the repeated OPTIONS section headers, which looks odd
and is inconsistent with swift-dispersion-populate.

Change-Id: I6d894e3b61002ddf7c0ea8a78cde226617eb11a6

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT vserver deletion fails if no lifs present

If no LIFs are present on a vserver (such as can happen if an error
occurs during share creation in driver_handles_share_servers=True
mode), the vserver deletion fails due to a recent change. This makes
the deletion path more resilient.

Change-Id: I475b7b00cd5ba6bb111e2002bb8faa49e4878592
Closes-Bug: #1607029

commit_message:
scenario001/ubuntu: re-enable telemetry

We bumped to Newton so Ceilometer Tempest tests should now pass.
Also unpin Tempest.

Change-Id: Ia796aa3f6c5581051a6a9f6f21e974f4e95159fd

Add ability to manage binding for neutron port

and a binding profile to a port

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support
for Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch adds the
convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I78adc9d836059fe9a2e8d1010408dd440d9d620e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/05/352405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py34,py27,pep8

commit_message:
Fix building query key for ceilometer alarm

Current building of query key doesn't check prefix
correctly, so fix this issue.

Change-Id: I002838d1dd57a48bd8e40f4c2c59f310e1c07987
Closes-bug: #1589415
(cherry picked from commit f4486930e199da11ef132728c4f63085bb233da6)

commit_message:
update front page of devstack docs

The devstack docs have gotten a bit meandering so even the quick start
guide doesn't get you to a working setup without referencing other
pages. This attempts to pull this back in a bit.

Change-Id: I608331cbdae9cbe4f3e8bd3814415af0390a54d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/29/351729/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Guides ====== .. warn:: The guides are point in time contributions, and may not always be up to date with the latest work in devstack. Walk through various setups used by stackers .. toctree:: :glob: :maxdepth: 1 guides/single-vm guides/single-machine guides/lxc guides/multinode-lab guides/neutron guides/devstack-with-nested-kvm guides/nova guides/devstack-with-lbaas-v2 All-In-One Single VM -------------------- Run :doc:`OpenStack in a VM <guides/single-vm>`. The VMs launched in your cloud will be slow as they are running in QEMU (emulation), but it is useful if you don't have spare hardware laying around. :doc:`[Read] <guides/single-vm>` All-In-One Single Machine ------------------------- Run :doc:`OpenStack on dedicated hardware <guides/single-machine>` This can include a server-class machine or a laptop at home. :doc:`[Read] <guides/single-machine>` All-In-One LXC Container ------------------------- Run :doc:`OpenStack in a LXC container <guides/lxc>`. Beneficial for intermediate and advanced users. The VMs launched in this cloud will be fully accelerated but not all OpenStack features are supported. :doc:`[Read] <guides/lxc>` Multi-Node Lab -------------- Setup a :doc:`multi-node cluster <guides/multinode-lab>` with dedicated VLANs for VMs & Management. :doc:`[Read] <guides/multinode-lab>` DevStack with Neutron Networking -------------------------------- Building a DevStack cluster with :doc:`Neutron Networking <guides/neutron>`. This guide is meant for building lab environments with a dedicated control node and multiple compute nodes. DevStack with KVM-based Nested Virtualization --------------------------------------------- Procedure to setup :doc:`DevStack with KVM-based Nested Virtualization <guides/devstack-with-nested-kvm>`. With this setup, Nova instances will be more performant than with plain QEMU emulation. Nova and devstack -------------------------------- Guide to working with nova features :doc:`Nova and devstack <guides/nova>`.

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in diskfile

* Fix bytes vs Unicode issues
* On Python 3, encode JSON to UTF-8 and decode it from UTF-8
* Open files in binary mode to avoid Unicode issues
* test_auditor: use bytes for content, open files in binary mode

Change-Id: Ifa84001493cfb57975d3b140b0d7e09020504bca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/90/347390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix busted release notes

A bad release note slipped through because the bash script
wasn't returing the actual results. This fixes the script
and the busted release note.

Change-Id: Id32557f34121fe82fac21d089e4117a72ff585e5
Closes-Bug: #1610312

commit_message:
Add scaffolding for trunk plugin/server-side driver integration

This patch introduces a framework and enhancements that allow the trunk
plugin to support multiple trunk drivers that integrate with Neutron core
technologies. A mechanism to validate the deployment configuration is
provided so that the trunk plugin can verify that it can start correctly.
Fail fast is desired to give prompt feedback to the operator in case of
configuration inconsistencies.

The OVS driver is developed as a proof of concept and the Linux Bridge
driver will be added as a follow up patch.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I5f9f8845e4108754748be3b64cce250c06e20f1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/350780/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.services.trunk import drivers self.drivers_patch = mock.patch.object(drivers, 'register').start() self.compat_patch = mock.patch.object( trunk_plugin.TrunkPlugin, 'check_compatibility').start()

Change-Id: I852f62b29f1faedf7ff19b42bbfb966f61d95c6e
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-07-29 16:28:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5a624adf0e4575f08658f9b70d953dde8dbab062', 'message': "Ironic: experimentally allow multiple compute services

This lifts some hash ring code from ironic (to be put into oslo
soon), to be used to do consistent hashing of ironic nodes among
multiple nova-compute services. The hash ring is used within the
driver itself, and is refreshed at each resource tracker.

get_available_nodes() will now return a subset of nodes,
determined by the following rules:

* any node with an instance managed by the compute service
* any node that is mapped to the compute service on the hash ring
* no nodes with instances managed by another compute service

The virt driver finds all compute services that are running the
ironic driver by joining the services table and the compute_nodes
table. Since there won't be any records in the compute_nodes table
for a service that is starting for the first time, the virt driver
also adds its own compute service into this list. The list of all
hostnames in this list is what is used to instantiate the hash ring.

As nova-compute services are brough up or down, the ring will
re-balance. It's important to note that this re-balance does not
occur at the same time on all compute services, so for some amount
of time, an ironic node may be managed by more than one compute
service. In other words, there may be two compute_nodes records
for a single ironic node, with a different host value. For
scheduling purposes, this is okay, because either compute service
is capable of actually spawning an instance on the node (because the
ironic service doesn't know about this hashing). This will cause
capacity reporting (e.g. nova hypervisor-stats) to over-report
capacity for this time. Once all compute services in the cluster
have done a resource tracker run and re-balanced the hash ring,
this will be back to normal.

It's also important to note that, due to the way nodes with instances
are handled, if an instance is deleted while the compute service is
down, that node will be removed from the compute_nodes table when
the service comes back up (as each service will see an instance on
the node object, and assume another compute service manages that
instance). The ironic node will remain active and orphaned. Once
the periodic task to reap deleted instances runs, the ironic node
will be torn down and the node will again be reported in the
compute_nodes table.

It's all very eventually consistent, with a potentially long time
to eventual.

There's no configuration to enable this mode; it's always running.
The code is exercised (but simple) when running with one compute
service; spinning up more invokes the hard bits. As such,
the release note for this change clarifies that this feature
is experimental for running with multiple compute services.

Change-Id: I852f62b29f1faedf7ff19b42bbfb966f61d95c6e
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-01 15:51:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b2a9ed3693716c69d4d3fd6fc65bb943e760a3e1', 'message': "Ironic: experimentally allow multiple compute services

ironic driver by joining the services table and the compute_nodes
table. Since there won't be any records in the compute_nodes table
for a service that is starting for the first time, the virt driver
also adds its own compute service into this list. The list of all
hostnames in this list is what is used to instantiate the hash ring.

As nova-compute services are brough up or down, the ring will
re-balance. It's important to note that this re-balance does not
occur at the same time on all compute services, so for some amount
of time, an ironic node may be managed by more than one compute
service. In other words, there may be two compute_nodes records
for a single ironic node, with a different host value. For
scheduling purposes, this is okay, because either compute service
is capable of actually spawning an instance on the node (because the
ironic service doesn't know about this hashing). This will cause
capacity reporting (e.g. nova hypervisor-stats) to over-report
capacity for this time. Once all compute services in the cluster
have done a resource tracker run and re-balanced the hash ring,
this will be back to normal.

It's also important to note that, due to the way nodes with instances
are handled, if an instance is deleted while the compute service is
down, that node will be removed from the compute_nodes table when
the service comes back up (as each service will see an instance on
the node object, and assume another compute service manages that
instance). The ironic node will remain active and orphaned. Once
the periodic task to reap deleted instances runs, the ironic node
will be torn down and the node will again be reported in the
compute_nodes table.

It's all very eventually consistent, with a potentially long time
to eventual.

There's no configuration to enable this mode; it's always running.
The code is exercised (but simple) when running with one compute
service; spinning up more invokes the hard bits. As such,
the release note for this change clarifies that this feature
is new and untested for running with multiple compute services.

Implements: blueprint ironic-multiple-compute-hosts
Change-Id: I852f62b29f1faedf7ff19b42bbfb966f61d95c6e
